data: Playback speed × Share post Share post at current time Share from 0:00 0:00 / 0:00 Transcript 2 AI Ramblings: Episode 39 OpenAI’s case AI Compute Hyper-Growth, Elon’s SpaceX IPO Ambitions, Google Gemini Developer Momentum, Apple’s New Design Head, US TikTok here, and more Michael Parekh Jan 25, 2026 2 Share Transcript Keywords AI, OpenAI, Google, Apple, SpaceX, revenue growth, advertising, AI data centers, leadership changes, technology trends Summary In this episode of AI Ramblings, hosts Michael Parekh and Neil McQuinney discuss the latest trends in AI, including OpenAI’s revenue growth and infrastructure needs, Elon Musk’s vision for SpaceX and AI data centers, Google’s competitive edge with its Gemini platform, and Apple’s leadership changes in relation to AI strategy. They also explore the implications of advertising in AI, the ability of AI to generate new ideas, and the recent developments surrounding TikTok’s ownership. The conversation highlights the dynamic landscape of AI technology and its impact on various industries. Takeaways OpenAI is pushing for significant investment in AI infrastructure. Elon Musk envisions AI data centers in space as a future opportunity. Google’s Gemini is gaining traction among developers and enterprises. Apple’s leadership changes signal a renewed focus on AI. Advertising is becoming a key revenue stream for AI companies. AI’s ability to generate new ideas is still under debate. The competition among AI companies is intensifying. TikTok’s transition to a US company may not change user experience significantly. AI compute capacity is a current pain point for many companies. The future of AI will involve collaboration between humans and AI.
